snippet: This month the state will begin giving some young immigrants driver’s licenses marked with a bold pink stripe and the words “no lawful status” printed in red.
abstract: North Carolina will begin giving some young immigrants driver's licenses marked with pink stripe and words 'no lawful status'; licenses, which have attracted both praise and criticism, will be issued to those who qualify for federal two year deportation deferrals under the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program.

byline.contributor: Julia Preston contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: This month the state will begin giving some young immigrants driver’s licenses marked with a bold pink stripe and the words “no lawful status” printed in red.

headline.main: North Carolina to Give Some Immigrants Driver’s Licenses, With a Pink Stripe
headline.print_headline: North Carolina to Give Some Immigrants Driver’s Licenses, With a Pink Stripe
